articles.description: American downhill skier Lindsey Vonn has ruptured an anterior cruciate ligament but still hopes to compete at the Winter Olympics.

articles.description: Ukraine's sports minister calls Fifa president Gianni Infantino "irresponsible" and "infantile" for saying it will look at lifting a ban on Russia.

articles.description: Williams team principal James Vowles says he is "not concerned at all" about missing the first pre-season test last week.

articles.description: Changes are to be made to the Laws of Cricket to permit bats previously deemed illegal in an effort to make the game affordable for amateur players.
articles.title: Laws of Cricket: MCC allow bats which were previously 'illegal'

articles.description: Dwight McNeil's partner criticises Crystal Palace for "messing" with his mental health after the collapse of his transfer from Everton.

articles.description: Pep Guardiola mischievously said he is "a little bit sad and upset" that Manchester City have only the seventh highest net spend on transfers in the Premier League over the last five years.
articles.title: Pep Guardiola: Man City boss jokes about spending
